Create and maintain automation scripts developed in PowerShell, Shell, C# or other scripting languages.  Manage cloud-based Infrastructure using Infrastructure As Code tools/technologies such as AWS CloudFormation, Terraform and Azure ARM templates.  Create and maintain Continuous Integration Automation with platforms such as Azure DevOps, Jenkins and Gitlab CI.  Work closely with IT team members, stakeholders and agile teams.  Assist in defining quality guidelines and standards for DevOps practices  Work closely with Architects to ensure all stakeholders are aligned with the organization DevOps strategy.  Perform ongoing routine DevOps maintenance tasks.        Required Qualifications:      Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or a related analytical field, or equivalent experience.  Minimum two years of software development experience.  Minimum two years experience with Jenkins, Azure DevOps, Gitlab CI or relevant CI/CD tools.  Minimum two years experience supporting DevOps practices.  Minimum one year of public cloud experience (AWS, Azure or Google Cloud).  Minimum two years experience working with source control systems (GitHub, Bitbucket, Azure DevOps, Microsoft Team Foundation Server)  Excellent verbal and written communication skills.  Address: 321 S. Kentucky Ave

DevOps Engineer    What you'll be doing:  Developing and supporting our managed services platform in public cloud to scale in efficiency, reliability and performance to meet our growing customer base Implementing changes to our platform as code (Infrastructure as a Code) Reviewing changes by other team members, writing documentation, doing refactoring and fixing occasional bugs Developing and operating CI/CD pipelines to keep platform up to date Automating routines such as OS and DB patching Resolving problems impacting the platform Participating in agile team practices and the development of them     What you'll bring to the table:  Excellent knowledge of modern managed services technologies such as Citrix and Appstream Good knowledge of Windows Server architecture Good knowledge of agile development practices Basic understanding of CI/CD pipelines and Infrastructure as a Code Experience in writing tests Excellent problem solving skills Interest in developing yourself and sharing knowledge with others     What we consider as an advantage:  Experience on working with business critical services Expertise on Azure technologies Previous software development experience     What we offer you in return:  An international career and learning opportunities in a rapidly growing software company A fun, ambitious, and committed team of smart people to work with. A respectful and professional, yet easy-going atmosphere where individual thinking is encouraged. Responsibilities in challenging projects from day one. The option to work remotely part-time (Outside of COVID, that is. Currently almost all work is remote.) Mobile phone, broadband, and healthcare benefits. Brand new offices in the center of Midtown Atlanta Plenty of vocational clubs and opportunities: e.g., brewing, orienteering, gym at the office Opportunity to work on a modern tech stack, e.g., Terraform, Ansible, Azure, Kubernetes, Docker, microservices, CI/CD     About RELEX  RELEX Solutions is a leading provider of cutting-edge retail optimization software. We offer our customers radically improved demand forecasting and supply chain optimization, which then can be leveraged into exponential benefits — optimizing store space, allocation, workforce, pricing and promotion strategies, all within our unified platform.  RELEX is trusted by leading brands including AutoZone, Sprouts, Morrisons, PetSmart, and Rossmann, and has offices across North America, Europe, and the Asia Pacific region.  RELEX Solutions is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

Overview The Multi‐State Partnership for Prevention is a fast‐paced, fast‐growing, mission‐driven company that leverages its portfolio of products to advance innovation in public health and healthcare. Our products support COVID vaccination and other public health and healthcare efforts in more than forty states. Successful candidates should be mission‐driven, have experience working with a diverse team, and have the ability to excel in a fast‐paced environment. The DevOps Engineer should demonstrate professional communication and interpersonal skills and a solid foundation in technology. The AWS Cloud/DevOps Engineer will work with the engineering team and focus on AWS infrastructure and automation. A key part of the role is championing and leading infrastructure as code. The Engineer will work closely with the VP of Engineering and senior developers to build, manage and automate the AWS infrastructure. Duties & Responsibilities:  Design and maintain secure, scalable, and highly available AWS‐based cloud infrastructure Collaborate with software engineering to define infrastructure and deployment requirements Provision, configure and maintain AWS cloud infrastructure defined as code Ensure configuration and compliance with configuration management tools Troubleshoot problems across a wide array of services and functional areas Build and maintain operational tools for deployment, monitoring, and analysis of AWS infrastructure and systems Perform ongoing infrastructure cost analysis and optimization  REQUIRED Knowledge, Skills, and Experience  Minimum of one year experience (or equivalent training) building and maintaining AWS infrastructure (VPC, IAM, multi‐account), EC2, Kubernetes (EKS), Security Groups, Terraform, CloudFront, S3, CI/CD pipelines. Strong understanding of how to secure AWS environments and meet compliance requirements Hands‐on experience deploying and managing infrastructure Solid foundation of networking Experience with deploying applications on AWS  PREFERRED Knowledge, Skills, and Experience  Experience or interest in software development Previous exposure to healthcare domain and security needs Previous startup experience would be a huge plus Latent desire and/or curiosity in related domain like software development, front‐end engineering, security or project management Location and Engagement Details Remote position available throughout the Americas (UTC‐3 through UTC‐10)  Job Type: Full-time Pay: From $114,000.00 per year Benefits:  Health insurance Paid time off  Schedule:  8 hour shift  Work Location: Remote

Work Styles at Zoom          In most cases, you will have the opportunity to choose your preferred working location from the following options when you join Zoom: in-person, hybrid or remote. Visit this page for more information about          Zoom's Workstyles    .          About Us          Zoomies help people stay connected so they can get more done together. We set out to build the best video product for the enterprise, and today help people communicate better with products like Zoom Contact Center, Zoom Phone, Zoom Events, Zoom Apps, Zoom Rooms, and Zoom Webinar.          We’re problem-solvers, working at a fast pace to design solutions with our customers and users in mind. Here, you’ll work across teams to deliver impactful projects that are changing the way people communicate and enjoy opportunities to advance your career in a diverse, inclusive environment.              You will be part of the Zoom Phone Backend team that maintains our backend infrastructure for our Cloud PBX and Contact Center Platforms. In addition, we monitor our application services and do log management for all backend services. You will do general team tasks, focus on the contact center platform, and support the Dev and QA teams launching this new product.              You will work with our Development, Product, Security, and Operations teams to troubleshoot production issues and the infrastructure design. Daily tasks may include CICD pipeline development, release deployment, and providing design advice to development teams looking to add new features to the product.              Responsibilities                You'll design and implement zero-downtime to accomplish a highly available service (99.999%)  You'll design and implement disaster recovery (DR) between different region Datacenters  You'll partner with vendors and the infrastructure engineering team for security and service availability  You'll troubleshoot production issues with DEV/QA teams, including performance and function issues  You'll troubleshoot and resolve service issues related to VoIP telephony platforms and applications  You'll provide troubleshooting for Phone systems and Zoom backend service  You'll provide the CI/CD model to deploy and configure the production system automatically                Requirements              You have 1+ year(s) of hands-on work experience in production system  You have knowledge of CI/CD tools and integration  You have experience with Kubernetes, container, and other microservice technologies  You have experience with Grafana, ELK, Zabbix, and other monitoring tools  You have experience with Linux and are familiar with Linux shells  You have experience with basic network troubleshooting  You're familiar with VoIP call terminology and phone system lingo  You understand SIP, RTP, RTCP, and related  You have BS degree in a related field  You have experience with at least 5 of the following: Linux, Network, SIP, VOIP, SBC, Jenkins, Git, Ansible, Grafana, Prometheus ELK, Redis, Docker, Kubernetes, Grafana, Zabbix, or AWS  You understand the principles of operations and limitations                Bonus Points              You have Linux/Network/AWS/K8S certifications  You have a MS degree in a related field                We believe that the unique contributions of all Zoomies is the driver of our success.
